Really, the most important quality, in my opinion, for a quarterback to have is gut instincts, then comes the decision-making and the timing and accuracy. Then comes the big arm and athleticism and those types of things. The gut instincts are critical for a quarterback, and you can see that. Not only did Michael Vick make a remarkable turnaround on the field, but his image is improving away from the game. When I started working on the book, Henry Kissinger said, "You tell it like it was.' We differed on some issues, and there"s nothing wrong with that. It was professional and healthy, Donald Rumsfeld says. Working on the book meant second-guessing his memory.
